intro: Delphinium rha, commonly known as the Sierra delphinium, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine meadows, preferring well-drained soils and full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem, while its flowers are composed of five petals and numerous stamens. Delphinium rha is a perennial herb that plays an important role in its ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators.
